title.narrative: Life-saving shelter assistance to internally displaced people affected by drought in western Herat and Baghdis provinces

description.narrative:
The proposed project will address the critical humanitarian needs caused by drought-induced displacement in western Herat and Badghis provinces, and as the onset of the harsh winter months exacerbate the situation of internally displaced families who are subject to even greater vulnerability from the elements. Based on the ES/NFI Cluster assessment of the needs conducted in Herat and Badghis provinces at the end of October 2018, UNHCR as the lead agency of the ES/NFI cluster will participate in the emergency intervention by facilitating the provision of emergency shelter to vulnerable groups of displaced women, men, girls and boys in western Herat and Badghis provinces. UNHCR is in a unique position under agreements with vendors in the region to immediately access stocks and as a UN Agency expedite shipping procedures and thus procure, transport and deliver the emergency shelters urgently and allow ES/NFO cluster members to distribute the assistance to the vulnerable families in the least time possible.
The project will include the procurement and transportation of emergency shelters to ES/NFI partners in the form of 15,100 family tents to cover the existing assessed gaps. In addition, UNHCR will work with partners for the smooth handover of tents to be distributed by members of the ES/NFI Cluster in western Herat and Badghis provinces to 105,700 individuals/15,100 families with an average family size of 7 individuals. The coordination is based on procedures as set out in the Delivery, Distribution and Monitoring of 15,100 Family Tents Standard Operating Procedures, Afghanistan November 2018 as accompanying this Proposal. Bi-monthly on-site and post-distribution monitoring is also incorporated into the project.
Through this, UNHCR will contribute towards the Afghanistan Humanitarian Response Plan objective (1) Save lives in the areas of highest needs, and objective (3) people stuck by sudden onset crises get the help they need on time.
The project will also contribute to two strategic objectives identified by the ES/NFI Cluster including:
i) access to basic lifesaving services through the provision of emergency shelter and NFIs ii) Mitigate further protection risks to allow safer and dignified living conditions.
These objectives also achieve protection outcomes through the integration of cross-cutting issues related to housing, land and property, protection, gender, age, disability and accountability to the affected populations.
